pr_title: Add redocly integration for admin api v1

timeline.message: Fix admin rest API v1 link
Add sample curl commands for admin rest API v1 resources
Add postman collection for admin REST API v1
Fix admin v1 postman collection url

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.message: Add schemas and examples for error responses

timeline.author: tgtshanika
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,18 @@ info:
     ```
     Now you have a valid access token, which you can use to invoke an API. 
     Navigate through the API descriptions to find the required API, obtain an access token as described above and invoke the API with the authentication header. 
-    If you use a different authentication mechanism, this process may change.    
+    If you use a different authentication mechanism, this process may change.

+    # Try out in Postman
+
+    If you want to try-out the embedded postman collection with "Run in Postman" option, please follow the guidelines listed below.
+    * All of the collection resources are configured to work with both Oauth2 Bearer and basic authentication schemes, with basic authentication scheme enabled by default.

timeline.message: Fix guidelines for postman collection try out

timeline.bodyText: An example is already defined for ApplicationThrottlePolicy schema definition. Why do we have to repeat an example here?
timeline.author: tgtshanika
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -262,6 +279,20 @@ paths:
             Location header contains URL of newly created entity.
           schema:
             $ref: '#/definitions/ApplicationThrottlePolicy'
+          examples:
+            application/json:

replies.bodyText: Since ApplicationThrottlePolicy is an extension of ThrottlePolicy when fetching the schema level example, it always displays the generic example values given in ThrottlePolicy definition. Therefore had to add a response level example(which has higher precedence than the schema level example) to override the generic example in a meaningful way.
replies.author: msm1992

timeline.bodyText: Shall we remove x-wso2-curl,  x-wso2-request, x-wso2-response extensions, since they are not in use?
timeline.author: tgtshanika
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2606,9 +2891,13 @@ paths:
       x-wso2-curl: "curl -k -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer 0d63e133-7ad6-3aeb-9ca9-9299e0708122" -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://apis.wso2.com/api/am/admin/v1/labels -d @data.json"
       x-wso2-request: "POST https://localhost:9443/api/am/admin/v1/labels
Authorization: Bearer 0d63e133-7ad6-3aeb-9ca9-9299e0708122
Content-Type: application/json

   {
       "name":"internal",
	"description":"label used for internal purpose",
	"accessUrls":[
	  "https://localhost:9095"
         ]
     }"

timeline.bodyText: Why do we have to repeat the example here? Can't we move this to label definition itself?
timeline.author: tgtshanika
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2617,6 +2906,19 @@ paths:
           required: true
           schema:
             $ref: '#/definitions/Label'
+          examples:
+            test:
+              summary: summary1

replies.bodyText: this was a typo. Fixed with 09f97e4
replies.author: msm1992
